SupportingEvidence: Strong neuroendocrine/neuronal program (CHGA, CHGB, INSM1, NEUROD1, SCG3, SCGN, SYT4) typical of primitive embryonal-like cells
Absence of mature hepatocyte markers (e.g., ALB, TTR, CYPs) argues against fetal subtype
Developmental/immaturity cues (NR2F1, BTBD3) and neuronal cytoskeleton gene TUBA1A
Secretory/vesicle and processing genes (PCSK1N, QPCT) and ECM component MFAP4 support tumor-cell identity over stromal/immune
Signaling genes (GNAS, CACYBP) associated with progenitor-like pathways seen in embryonal hepatoblastoma
SuggestedExperiments: IHC/IF for INSM1, NEUROD1, CHGA/CHGB, EPCAM, KRT19, SOX9, and hepatocyte markers (ALB, HNF4A)
Ki-67 immunostaining to validate proliferation status
Electron microscopy to assess dense-core neurosecretory granules
Score the cluster against published fetal vs embryonal HB transcriptomic signatures (bulk/SC)
scRNA-derived CNV analysis to confirm tumor lineage; beta-catenin IHC/CTNNB1 sequencing for Wnt activation
Pseudotime/trajectory analysis to position this cluster along fetal–embryonal differentiation
